definition: tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: The tottering cause of Sichuan Opera seems to have successors.
sentences.chinese: 风雨飘摇中的川剧事业似乎后继有人。

sentences.english: In the stormy days, storms will steal my pain.
sentences.chinese: 在风雨飘摇的日子，风暴将窃取我的痛苦。

sentences.english: In the evening let me carry thy lamp through the stormy path.
sentences.chinese: 在黄昏的时候，让我拿着您的灯走过风雨飘摇的道路。

sentences.english: But police makes to the blow of pilfer edition the career swaying in the midst of a raging storm of this group of youths.
sentences.chinese: 但警方对盗版的打击使这群年轻人的事业风雨飘摇。

sentences.english: It is anti-traditional created a wave of precarious tradition.
sentences.chinese: 正是反传统的浪潮造就了风雨飘摇的传统。

definition: internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
great mansion on the verge of collapse (idiom); hopeless situation
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
deep water and scorching fire/abyss of suffering (idiom)
